page.title: 12HEALTH
page.content: HERNE BAY AMBULANCE STATION HAS NOT GOT AN OFFICE ALTHOUGH FIVE EMERGENCY AMBULANCES OPERATE FROM HERNE BAY. THE AREA THAT THEY COVER REACHES FROM RECULVER TO WHITSTABLE AND ALL THE WAY ALONG THE THANET WAY. THE HOSPITAL THAT THEY USUALLY TAKE THEIR PATIENTS TO IS KENT AND CANTERBURY. THE MOST COMMON KIND OF EMERGENCY CALL OUT IS WHEN PEOPLE COLLAPSE OF A HEART ATTACK OR SHOCK. IN SUMMER THERE ARE ABOUT 15 EMERGENCY CALLS EACH DAY, BUT IT DEPENDS ON WHAT TIME OF YEAR IT IS. THE ROUTINE CALLS THAT THE AMBULANCE COVER EACH DAY ARE URGENT DOCTORS ADMISSIONS, MATERNITY CASES AND OUT- PATIENT APPOINTMENTS. THERE ARE PEAK TIMES WHEN THERE SEEM TO BE A LOT OF ACCIDENTS. THIS IS O7.OO A.M. - O.9.3O A.M., 12.OO - 13.OO AND 15.OO - 18.OO P.M. MONDAYS TO FRIDAYS. FACTORY WORKERS USUALLY HAVE LOTS OF ACCIDENTS
